topics.body:
"As strange it is, I’m not terribly scared of the show’s end. We will eventually get over it. The fandom will not die overnight. New fanfics will continue to get written years after the end. New fanart will be drawn. And so on."

"What I fear is that decades from now I find the old, dusty hard drive from the 2010’s I’ve already forgotten about. After some fussing with electronics, I manage to power it up and to my astonishment it still works. I find hundreds of gigabytes of images, fanfics, episodes, PMVs and everything I stashed away after the fandom finally dwindled. I nostalgize for days, re-read old fanfics, watch the episodes I already forgot even existed. And I even remember the nicknames of you guys."

"But there will be no one to talk to. No one to talk about the episodes. Nothing. Because the fandom hasn’t existed in decades, it eventually did wither away. I sit in the dark corner and weep silently. And so do you all."

"The show may end but once a brony, always a _brony_."

*(This isn't even mine. This was posted almost 2 years ago by JP. I wonder where he is because I haven't seen him for a while.)*
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976

No wonder I'm still alive.

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5550aba16368721da93e3200#post_5550aba16368721da93e3200
What if that were true though...

What if when we sometimes fall into random mood swings, it's actually future emotions being detected?
topics.author: 5307a92d6368722c6c0d0100

topics.body:
"@Zak_Inc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5550ac366368721da95d3300#post_5550ac366368721da95d3300
That is a pretty good theory. Our bodies react to things it knows but we don't. Our knowledge is limited to the mind and soul but once verse enough, our bodies hold our memories. The feelings that predict the outcome of ourselves in the choices we make, were but our bodies reminding us of something that we have learned but forgotten.

The future reminds us of the past so that we will never forget it.




Urgh, mood swings making me go philosophical.
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976

"What I fear is that decades from now I find the old, dusty hard drive from the 2010’s I’ve already forgotten about. After some fussing with electronics, I manage to power it up and to my astonishment it still works. I find hundreds of gigabytes of images, fanfics, episodes, PMVs and everything I stashed away after the fandom finally dwindled. I nostalgize for days, re-read old fanfics, watch the episodes I already forgot even existed. And I even remember the nicknames of you guys."

"But there will be no one to talk to. No one to talk about the episodes. Nothing. Because the fandom hasn’t existed in decades, it eventually did wither away. I sit in the dark corner and weep silently. And so do you all."

"The show may end but once a brony, always a _brony_."

This reminds me the days when I was a total Kill la Kill fan.
..Well, I still like the anime, and the fan art and everything, but you don't see anyone talking about it anymore. Barely.
